revised_title: Description of a Meteor Sighting in Chigwell Row, Essex
tldr: The author, William Dutton, describes a meteor sighting in Chigwell Row, Essex, on October 20, 1759. The meteor was moving north to south, with a round form and a bluish cast. It vanished at a height of 4 to 5 degrees above the horizon, leaving a faint light tail similar to a comet.
